content: What iconic fashion item, also the title of a 2006 film starring Meryl Streep, is named after an American magazine?

The iconic fashion item you're referring to is likely "The Devil Wears Prada," which is both a novel and a film starring Meryl Streep. However, the title doesn't directly correspond to an American magazine. Wait a minute, "Vogue" is a well-known American fashion magazine, and Meryl Streep did star in "The Devil Wears Prada," which fictionalizes the world of high fashion, particularly revolving around Vogue magazine. So, perhaps the connection is that the film is based on the world of Vogue, but the fashion item might be a specific piece or style that became iconic due to the film.

Alternatively, maybe you're thinking of a different magazine or a different film. Could you provide more details or clarify the question?
